metadata.title: RHSA-2020:2440: OpenShift Container Platform 4.3.25 openshift security update (Moderate)
metadata.description:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform is Red Hat's cloud computing
Kubernetes application platform solution designed for on-premise or private
cloud deployments.

Security Fix(es):

* kubernetes: A server side request forgery (SSRF) in the kube-controller-manager allows certain authorized users to leak up to 500 bytes of arbitrary information from the master's host network (CVE-2020-8555)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

bugzilla.text: kubernetes: Server side request forgery (SSRF) in kube-controller-manager allows users to leak secret information

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
openshift-hyperkube is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
